long_description:
There’s a new craze hitting the wine world, and it has nothing to do with the latest trendy varietal. Paint and Sip parties have been growing in popularity and are the perfect opportunity to channel your inner artist while enjoying a glass of wine. Here is all you need to know about the Paint and Sip, and where to find one on your Napa Valley getaway.

 

What is a Paint and Sip party?

Sip on some of the finest wine from the Napa Valley while creating a visual masterpiece under the direction of an art instructor. In your professionally-led class, you will have the opportunity to paint a (usually pre-determined) canvas with a group of like-minded wine drinkers. No need to bring art supplies, the venue will provide canvas, paints, brushes, and protective smocks for your session. Don’t worry about your art skills either, your instructor will walk you through the painting process, from mixing colors, to what brush strokes to use to create your work of art.

 

Don’t forget the wine! Check the location’s food and beverage policy to find out if you should bring a bottle. Most of the Napa Valley’s Paint and Sip parties are hosted by a local winery, so all you need to bring is yourself. Keep your finished work of art for a perfect memento from your wine country vacation.

 

Where to find a Paint and Sip party in the Napa Valley

In the largest wine region in the United States, finding a Paint and Sip party is simple. Check Visit Napa Valley for a calendar of upcoming events, which almost always includes a Paint and Sip party at locations throughout wine country. Paint the Town is another excellent source for Paint and Sip events. Paint the Town partners with local wineries, restaurants, and bars operating in the Napa Valley to throw public Paint and Sip gatherings for wine country visitors. Visit Paint the Town for their calendar of events.

 

Still to come this summer, Fairwinds Estate Winery in Calistoga has a few Paint and Sip events scheduled. In addition to art instruction and supplies, their creative and wine tasting experience includes a three-glass wine tasting featuring their Winemaker Classic Flight with light snacks, hosted by their Wine Educator. For more information and tickets to a Paint and Sip afternoon on their terrace overlooking the Mayacamas Mountains, visit Fairwinds Estate Winery.

 

Sip and Stay at the Wine Country Inn

After an afternoon of painting, retreat to the romantic and secluded Wine Country Inn. Our boutique hotel is close to the historic downtowns of St. Helena and Calistoga, renowned fine dining restaurants, and world-class wineries. Enjoy a glass of wine on your private deck or patio as you overlook the Napa Valley vineyards. To taste more wines of the Napa Valley, join us every Friday and Saturday evening for a complimentary wine reception featuring a local vintner.
title: Paint, Drink, and be Merry at a Napa Valley ‘Paint and Sip’ Party
